head.title: IN MY . . . BRIEFCASE: THOMAS J. DONOHUE

identified-content.org: Chamber of Commerce of the United States

hedline.hl1: IN MY . . . BRIEFCASE: THOMAS J. DONOHUE

abstract.p: Contents of briefcase carried by Thomas J Donohue, president of United States Chamber of Commerce described; photo of Donohue and briefcase (S)

block.p: THE president of the United States Chamber of Commerce, Thomas J. Donohue, visited 140 cities in 1999. And as a former Eagle Scout, he likes to be prepared for the inevitable hitches.

His briefcase contains an elaborate array of toiletries and first-aid gear -- ''my travel-everywhere packet'' -- as well as vitamins, a two-year appointment calendar, schedules for basketball and hockey games at Washington's MCI Center, a road atlas, earplugs and a small screwdriver for repairs to eyewear.
THE president of the United States Chamber of Commerce, Thomas J. Donohue, visited 140 cities in 1999. And as a former Eagle Scout, he likes to be prepared for the inevitable hitches.

His briefcase contains an elaborate array of toiletries and first-aid gear -- ''my travel-everywhere packet'' -- as well as vitamins, a two-year appointment calendar, schedules for basketball and hockey games at Washington's MCI Center, a road atlas, earplugs and a small screwdriver for repairs to eyewear.
''I could fix your glasses,'' he volunteered.
The first-aid supplies also come in handy for Mr. Donohue, who was born in Brooklyn and worked as an emergency-room attendant at St. John's Univeristy. ''He thinks he's Marcus Welby,'' an aide said.
